newsitem.title: UK: BFI up 12 as panamaxes remain firm.
newsitem.headline: BFI up 12 as panamaxes remain firm.

text.p: The Baltic Freight Index (BFI) was up 12 at 1,515 and although Caper rates continued to soften, panamaxes moved in the opposite direction in most areas.

UBT fixed G.Bottiglieri 75,200 dwt delivery Constanza trip Far East at $16,000 daily and Andre have booked Mare Vikingo 64,000 dwt delivery Lisbon April 4/10 for five to seven months at $11,400 daily.
Problems in the Mississippi River have complicated the export situation but activity from Brazil and Argentina has more thasn compensated.

In the east, minerals charterers continued to drive rates upwards. MOSK for example were said to have fixed Capetano Giovanni 74,500 dwt delivery prompt Japan for an east Australian round voyage at between $13,500 and $13,750 daily.
At 1300 GMT BIFFEX was unchanged to five points up and turnover totalled 49 lots.
